intro: Acyntha guineensis, commonly known as African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a compact rosette of leaves. Its flowers are usually borne on tall, leafless stalks and can vary in color from white to deep purple. Acyntha guineensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is widely cultivated as a houseplant.
